body_html:
I can assure you that it is impossible to do cross-validation since loading the model takes too long. Probably the question is still unclear, all these people are asking to train the model for one epoch, run the validation set, and restart until the train loop is finished.

So assuming we have 100 epochs, we need to run 100 times the estimator in train mode and 100 times the estimator in evaluate mode. This adds up to 200 times the model is restored. Come on guy! You are Google, are you? train_and_evaluate will just evaluate after the train is done. Meaning, that it will first train for, following our example, 100 epochs and then run the evaluation one once!

I find really hard to believe that, after all these people explain the same problem, is still so unclean. Without any way to properly do cross-validation, the Estimator is almost a useless piece of software since we can not even see if our model is overfitting or not using a validation set.

@martinwicke Thank you to quickly reply to us, I hope now the problem is cleaner.

I can assure you that it is impossible to do cross-validation since loading the model takes too long. Probably the question is still unclear, all these people are asking to train the model for one epoch, run the validation set, and restart until the train loop is finished. 

So assuming we have 100 epochs, we need to run 100 times the estimator in train mode and 100 times the estimator in evaluate mode. This adds up to 200 times the model is restored. Come on guy! You are Google, are you? `train_and_evaluate` will just evaluate after the train is done. Meaning, that it will first train for, following our example, 100 epochs and then run the evaluation one once! 

I find really hard to believe that, after all these people explain the same problem, is still so unclean. Without any way to properly do cross-validation, the Estimator is almost a useless piece of software since we can not even see if our model is overfitting or not using a validation set.

@martinwicke Thank you to quickly reply to us, I hope now the problem is cleaner.
